content:
The windows snipping tool, which your keyboard shortcut invokes, automatically places the image on the clipboard and saves it. Generally to a folder called screenshots unless you have changed it. So you could just paste the image into your message, or attach the file.

Why can't you forward the message? That sounds like a far better solution as the forward button is designed to forward messages without all this messing around.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
One of the fundamentally worst things you can do it place your profile folder in the documents folder. The outcome will eventually be the profile data will be lost or corrupted. Primarily this is because the very nature of Thunderbird mail database is not compatible with the AV scanning and streaming backups that are to often be found in documents folders. Like cloud backup etc

See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/dedicated-profile-thunderbird-installation This issue may be related to that.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
For us to better investigate this issue, we will need some more information.

Could you please do the following?

  1. Open the menu > Help > Troubleshooting Information, then click Copy text to Clipboard.
  2. Go to https://pastebin.mozilla.org/, paste the clipboard by right clicking in the large text area, select paste from the menu, change the retention period to expire in 28 days, use the Paste Snippet button to create a page containing your info, then copy the resulting URL (address) of the page created.
  3. Open a reply to this post, and paste the URL to your troubleshooting information you just copied.
  4. Please also provide results for the following test on your system
    • Does Thunderbird work as expected in Thunderbird troubleshooting mode?
    • Does Thunderbird work as expected with your OS started in safe mode with Networking. Instructions for each operating system: Windows 10/11, Windows 8, Windows 7, OSX
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Sending among coworkers is sending from one domain to itself. When sending to other domains, there will always be a higher possibility that one or more of them may flag your domain for security shortfalls that are not identified within the host domain. This could happen for many reasons, such as IP address, server security setup, and more.
creator: davidsk

content:
Informazioni utili da fornire nelle richieste al forum:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
creator: @next

creator: mozilla98

content: The usual reason that such folders can't be deleted is because the email provider prefers them. You might first check your online account first to see if the folders can be deleted. If so, you could then replace with a different name, although the email provider might switch it back.
creator: davidsk

content:
I discovered the problem - a recent Norton update

I changed the gmail SMTP port to 587 and tried to send an email. The certificate conflict message was displayed. This time I clicked on the View button and it produced a report that indicated the certificate Issuer name was generated by Norton Antivirus for SSL/TLS scanning. Didn't make sense. So I opened Norton Antivirus and disabled Email scanning and all the emails dropped. Unbelievable!!
creator: calan1959b
